# controller(_:didChangeContentWith:)

**Instance Method**

Notifies the receiver about changes to the content in the fetched results controller, by using a collection difference.

## Declaration

```swift
optional func controller(_ controller: NSFetchedResultsController<any NSFetchRequestResult>, didChangeContentWith diff: CollectionDifference<NSManagedObjectID>)
```

## Discussion

This method is only invoked if the controller’s [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSFetchedResultsController/sectionNameKeyPath] property is `nil` and [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSFetchedResultsControllerDelegate/controller(_:didChangeContentWith:)-4kezq] is not implemented.

If this method is implemented, no other delegate methods are invoked.

## Responding to Changes

- **controller(_:didChangeContentWith:)**: Notifies the receiver about changes to the content in the fetched results controller, by using a diffable data source snapshot.
- **controllerWillChangeContent(_:)**: Notifies the receiver that the fetched results controller is about to start processing of one or more changes due to an add, remove, move, or update.
- **controller(_:didChange:at:for:newIndexPath:)**: Notifies the receiver that a fetched object has been changed due to an add, remove, move, or update.
- **controller(_:didChange:atSectionIndex:for:)**: Notifies the receiver of the addition or removal of a section.
- **controllerDidChangeContent(_:)**: Notifies the receiver that the fetched results controller has completed processing of one or more changes due to an add, remove, move, or update.
